instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0SW_LCD: What is PP3V3_S0SW_LCD? PP3V3_S0SW_LCD is a 3.3v power rail necessary to power the image circuitry on the screen. This is necessary to get a picture on the screen. .
definitions.PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT? PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the backlight on the LCD screen, this is necessary to get the screen to light up..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: 3437 liquid damage not booting
threads.message:
Hi, I have an Air 3437 that came in with liquid damage, sometimes rebooting by itself but working. Some corrosion around <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR>. Replaced <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> (<SIGNAL>RESET_L</SIGNAL>, maybe thats why it was rebooting sometimes), alsoY1915 had a tiny bit of corrosion under it, replaced it. I have orange and green light, the fan spins one time 12 seconds, reboots, and then keeps spinning high, no display. <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> area looks OK no shorts and all R measure OK. I also have 32 on clockchip.

The board seems to have all power lines, CPU got 1.75 and 1.5 and Dram power is also there. I also have <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>. Tried SMS reset and Bypass, reset did nothing, bypass gives me super high fanspin but no boot. Mouse has a light on USB and I also have <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>. I have 0v on <SIGNAL>PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> but both sides of the Fuse have 8.6v. Also missing is <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL>, no shorts on <CHIP>U8300</CHIP>, 3.<SIGNAL>3V_5S</SIGNAL> is there but no <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL> which comes from PCH. I have <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> as well as <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> it seems SMC is running. Ideas?

threads.title: 3437 liquid damage not booting
threads.message:
Confirm if you get USB activity.
USB OSX pendrive/HDD adapter with Link LED is best option.
No reason to search video, if no USB activity.

This board restarts two times before stays on, as normal behaviour.
Try known good BIOS.

threads.title: 3437 liquid damage not booting
threads.message: Replaced smc and fixed. The liquid spill was near smc so might have screwed it although it did spit out voltages.

threads.title: 3437 liquid damage not booting
threads.message:
In such case, always good to start reballing SMC.
Many times corrosion just damages the solder balls.

threads.title: 3437 liquid damage not booting
threads.message: I just fixed a board (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A) this week that had strange SMC behavior similar to what you had.. It would some times boot then drop out and reboot. Sometimes just drop out and require a power cycle. I re-flowed the SMC and it started working normally so I sent it out. It came back a day later and had no green light. Replaced SMC and it worked perfect. I think my SMC was on the way out and re-flowing it just bought it time.

threads.title: 3437 liquid damage not booting
threads.message:
If no corrosion detected close to SMC, then change it directly is the best option.
However, you can inspect chip pads once removed.
If you detect something strange, can try to reflow it.
If you have enough SMC stock, change is good.

threads.title: 3437 liquid damage not booting
threads.message: I had reflowed the SMC and reballed 2 x. I think it might have died in the proces, after replacing it all good :) thanks
